p: In 2012, Park et al. ( Park et al., 2012) studied the role of diarylheptanoids isolated from the stem bark of Alnus japonica were found to be inhibitors of SARS-CoV PLpro, using a recombinant vector expressed in E. coli. Interestingly, at the same concentration, no detectable inhibition of the other Coronavirus protease (3CLpro) was observed. The most effective inhibitor of PLpro was the hirsutenone (IC 50 value of 4.1 μM). Moreover, differently from the others derivatives, hirsutenone resulted an efficient inhibitor of also the other protease, 3CLpro (IC 50 value of 36.1 μM). The structure activity analyses revealed that catechol and α, β-unsaturated carbonyl moiety in the molecule were fundamental factors influencing its inhibitory actions against PLpro ( Park et al., 2012).
